On #BlackHistoryMonth, we are reminded that we stand on the shoulders of giants like Vel. We must work to honor her legacy. (4/4)

I first met Vel at an oratorical contest and she saw me for who I was, not my worn clothes. I would later join her in protesting against housing discrimination with Father Groppi. That was Vel, always fighting for justice. (3/4)

To accomplish all that she did required tenacity, which she had. But she was also very down-to-earth. She wasn't concerned about how much money or status you had because she was focused on pursuing equality. (2/4)

Vel Phillips was a dear friend and mentor to me. She blazed trails as Wisconsin‚Äôs first black Secretary of State and the first woman and Black American to join Milwaukee‚Äôs Common Council. (1/4) https://t.co/bN9jtb6BWB

Bc of this fund, I could have an abortion.

I still remember clearly. It was the first time I had been to NY, so it was a lot to take in. (1/3)
